page.title: 15THE WYE VALLEY WALK
page.content: The {Wye valley Walk}runs through the area and is marked by{yellow arrows.} It mainly follows the old{Ross-on-Wye {to Monmouth}railway. Among the interesting features on this stretch of the walk are: 1.) {The Biblins}(see page 7) with its suspension bridge and picnic site. 2.) {King Arthur's Caves}on the side of the{Doward}are very deep and are supposed to be connected with legendary King. 3.) {Standing Stones}such as the{ {Suck Stone (541141), Far Harkening {Rock (541151) and Near Harkening Rock {(545139).}The Suck Stone is one of the largest whole standing stones in Great Britain.
